channel.title: stem on Bits to Bytes
channel.description: Recent content in stem on Bits to Bytes

item.title: A Seed Called VidUp
item.description: When I first got into programming I was bewildered by the near infinite things one could accomplish through code. And like many people in the beginning, I struggled with the basic concepts. There was a strong sense of uncertainty within me at the time. I distinctly remember thinking, “Am I really cut out for coding? There’s other people way better than me already.” This sense of uncertainty is normal for anyone learning a new skill.

item.title: Say YES!
item.description: Have you ever wondered what it would be like if you just started saying yes to life and all the opportunities that come your way? I know after watching the Yes Man movie (I recommend it!) when I was little I thought the prospect of embracing every experience sounded fun and exciting… yet I really did not realise where it would lead me! Somehow I became a person who seemingly did so many things and ended up loving meeting people and embracing new adventures.

item.title: Sydney Hacks
item.description: It was January 2020. I had just returned from NCSS in Melbourne and had won a hackathon at the Academy of Entrepreneurs. The energy of the camps lingered on me and I was itching to do something, something big, exceptional and meaningful to me. Now, almost every bit of knowledge I have around programming came from online courses. When the topics were easy, I cruised through the tutorials, but when my code stopped working, it was truly frustrating to figure out what’s wrong.

item.title: A Word from our Founder
item.description: Hey, everyone! Developing Bits to Bytes has been a jam-packed journey for me over the past couple of months. The team and I have iterated over the idea several times, putting in hours of effort into bringing it to life. Now as I type up this first post, I find myself teeming with excitement at the possibilities of what Bits to Bytes can grow into. A strong passion for science, technology, engineering and maths has inspired me to come up with this idea.
